meanings.definition: To surpass in cleverness or skill.
meanings.sent1: She outslicked her opponent with a brilliant strategy.
meanings.sent2: The detective outslicked the criminal by solving the case quickly.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outslicked the hunter by leading him on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking outslicked any doubts about her intelligence.
meanings.sent5: He outslicked his classmates in the math competition by solving the problems in record time.

meanings.definition: To outdo in a competition or challenge.
meanings.sent1: The athlete outslicked his rivals in the race.
meanings.sent2: She outslicked the other chefs in the cooking competition.
meanings.sent3: The team outslicked their opponents by scoring the winning goal in the last minute.
meanings.sent4: His determination outslicked any obstacles in his path to success.
meanings.sent5: They outslicked the competition by offering a unique product that stood out.
